author: m.kalinin
content: What if a user have a contract address in withdrawal credentials that is a proxy and allows to change the address that can claim the funds after withdrawals?

author: m.kalinin
content: Do you want to create an issue for further discussion? We could raise it during one of Eth2 Implementers or Merge Implementers calls

author: potuz
content: That works for that user, but it doesn't enforce any prevention of spam of the network as what Jim mentions

author: jcrtp
content: Indeed, I put together a draft on the PR on the Rocket Pool fork <https://github.com/rocket-pool/eth2.0-specs/pull/1>

author: jcrtp
content: I asked some of our community members to help iterate on it because we wanted it to be solid before submitting it for real, but I can clean up what's there and submit it to the main repo if you'd like that iteration to happen on the real thing

author: m.kalinin
content: We don't allow for changing withdrawal credentials but everyone uses contract instead and there is no DOS vector as changing effective withdrawal address in the contract would be a regular contract call transaction

author: m.kalinin
content: This should be pretty enough to continue with it

author: jcrtp
content: I will briefly go over the feedback I got last night in the comments (I just got up heh) and I will submit it

author: potuz
content: Sure but that will mean enforcing that everyone uses a contract, which is a bit complicated because you'll need a mechanism anyway to switch the bls keys to those contracts.

author: potuz
content: I think anyway we will eventually want to have some consensus version of gas, or unifying the p2p stacks of consensus and execution, cause it's not hard to envision that there will be other consensus signals one would want to broadcast

author: m.kalinin
content: Right, but we will have a mechanism to turn your `0x0` to `0x1`, this is required by withdrawals. So, it could be a contract after all, for those who is willing to have an option to change their withdrawal address for multiple times.

author: potuz
content: I see so you're saying that either way we can implement a one time change of withdrawal credentials, thus avoiding DOS, and still allow several changes for those who so decide. This is fine by me as this will only require the beacon chain to check that you can only move bls ---> eth1 at the cost of not benefiting the few that already have eth1 addresses

author: m.kalinin
content: Yep, those who use eth1 addresses might be using such contracts already, though not sure about that. Is there a published contract code that matches this kind of pattern or even a service that provide an ability to deploy such contracts? Multisig wallet could be used to provide this functionality, right?

author: jcrtp
content: I have submitted it here: <https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/2454>
